div.a: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1370 Asia Minor, northwestern, 1929 (82) Burial: 225 B.C. (Seyrig) Contents: 60+ AR Alexander III: 14 late post. tetradr. (Assus2 ANS 1944.100.31397 , Pergamum 5 ANS 1944.100.31383 ANS 1967.152.293 ANS 1944.100.31389 , Mytilene 1 ANS 1944.100.31447 , Myrina 1, Tenedos 1, Erythrae 2 ANS 1944.100.32129 ANS 1944.100.32128 , Chios 2 ANS 1944.100.32169 ANS 1944.100.32165 ) Lysimachus: 5 post. tetradr. (Byzantium 2 ANS 1944.100.81476 , Cius 2 ANS 1944.100.81641 ANS 1944.100.81629 , Parium 1 ANS 1944.100.81659 ) Prusias I: 1 tetradr. Eumenes I: 1 tetradr. Attalus I: 27 tetradr. Antiochus II: 5 tetradr. (Lampsacus 2 ANS 1944.100.78269 ANS 1944.100.78270 , Alexandreia Troas 2 ANS 1944.100.78282 ANS 1944.100.78280 , Lysimacheia 1) Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Ilium) 2 dr. (Antiocheia 1 ANS 1967.152.602 , Sardes 1) Antiochus Hierax: 4 tetradr. (Lampsacus ANS 1944.100.78275 ANS 1944.100.78273 ANS 1967.152.676 ANS 1944.100.78274 ANS 1967.152.677 ) Disposition: New York 25 (Alexander 11, Lysimachus 4, Seleucids 10); Naville July 2, 1930, 493, 612, 915-27, 1063, 1065 Newell, WSM, p. 320, note 3 Westermark, Philetairos, p. 15 Seyrig, RN 1963, p. 26, note 1
